channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Clawing back foreign aid is tied to 'waste, fraud and abuse.' What's the evidence?
item.description: As the Senate prepares to vote on a bill to rescind $40 billion in promised foreign aid, critics of the measure say a thorough governmental review of ...

item.title: Thousands of veterans get help from Congress to save their homes from foreclosure
item.description: A bipartisan Congress has come to the rescue of vets at risk of losing their homes, after administrations from both parties tore up VA safety nets for...

item.title: Lesotho declares state of disaster after massive tariff threats from U.S.
item.description: Lesotho, a tiny mountain kingdom in Southern Africa, has just declared a two-year state of disaster after being threatened with the highest U.S. tarif...

item.title: ICE data shows less than 1% of deportees had murder convictions
item.description: A majority of the people deported by ICE this year were convicted of traffic or immigration offenses, not violent crimes, according to data obtained b...

item.title: 'It's just better!' Trump says Coca-Cola to change key US ingredient
item.description: Coca-Cola said they "appreciate President Trump's enthusiasm", without confirming they plan to make the tweak.

item.title: Prosecutor in Diddy and Epstein cases fired by justice department
item.description: It is not clear why Maurene Comey was removed from her job at the elite justice department office in Manhattan.

item.title: DOJ fires Maurene Comey, who helped prosecute Sean "Diddy" Combs and Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Maurene Comey is the daughter of former FBI director James Comey, who was terminated by President Trump in 2017.

item.title: Two dead and many injured in Russian strike on Ukrainian shopping centre
item.description: President Zelensky called the strike in Dobropillia "horrific", accusing Russia of "trying to take as many lives as possible".

item.title: Ramaphosa struggles to mend fences with Trump
item.description: President Ramaphosa's special envoy has reportedly been rejected by the US, in the latest sign of frosty relations.

item.title: 1 dead, 13 hurt after lightning strike in Jackson Township, New Jersey
item.description: One person was killed and 13 others were injured after being struck by lightning in Jackson Township, New Jersey, on Wednesday.

item.title: Top Trump administration antitrust official faces criticism over approach, sources say
item.description: Friction within the Trump administration has cropped up with the Justice Department team that fights monopolies, sources tell CBS News.

item.title: Who are the Druze and why is Israel attacking Syria?
item.description: A fresh wave of deadly sectarian violence has rocked Syria, highlighting the country's fragile security landscape.

item.title: Tsunami advisory canceled after 7.3 magnitude earthquake off Alaska
item.description: A major earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 7.3 initially triggered a tsunami warning for the southern Alaska Peninsula. It was later downgrade...

item.title: Tariffs are a tax. Are you already paying it?
item.description: It's been over three months since President Trump announced very big across-the-board tariffs on imports from nearly every territory on Earth–includin...

item.title: Nebraska keeps ban on food assistance for those with drug convictions
item.description: Under a legacy of the war on drugs, some states still ban people with drug convictions from getting government food assistance. Nebraska lawmakers tri...
